body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner George McMillin states that at the March Term (1861) of the city court of Louisville he was fined one hundred dollars on an Indictment for shooting at M Henneleyer, Said Henneleyer, was not injured by Petitioner & shot at him first He was fined fifty dollars for an assault & battey charged to have been committed --

Your Petitioner is a young man, and poor. The costs in these cases is large, and as much as petitioner is perselly able to pay now, He therefore most respectfully aks your Excellency to respite said fines for a short time until he can have opportunity to settle: These fines, are excessive & he hopes you will relieve him
We the undersigned know the petitioner George McMillen & respectfully Join in this petition

S. N. Hall
M. Nyles
George McMillen
W. G. Reasor
W, A, Hundley
Hamilton T. Figg
Chs. Hatsely
Robert A Hamilton
Isham Talbot
James Talbert
J, G White
J B Hemp
Peter Renter
John Vetter
Wm Gregory
Chas Schage
John McMahon

Respite 6 mo
Louisville City Ct
$100.
$50. } Misdemeanor
Geo. McMillen
Issd Mar. 21. 1861
